definitions.title: n.pr.m
definitions.body: Nimrod (etym. and meaning wholly unknown; Thes (dub.) sub [[מָרַד]] rebel (of which Hebr. may have thought [cf. Lag:BN 105]); in fact prob. Bab. name;
= a god e.g. Marduk, We:Comp. Hex. (2), 308 f.; Nimrod, Encycl. Brit. (9). xvii. 511, RS:Sem. i. 91 n.; 2d ed. 92; Hom:PSBA xv (1893), 291–300 prop. Narûdu = *Namra-uddu, a star-god.

< name of Bab. king or prince: Nu-marad = ‘Man of Marad’ cf. Dl:Pa 220 De:Ge 10:8 [1887]; more plausibly = Nazi-maraddash (marattash, murudas), Hpt:Andover Rev. July, 1884, 93 f. Dl:K (1884) Say:Athen. Feb. 16, 1895, Acad. Mk 2, 1895 (cf. Che:ib. Mk 9),—i.e. a Kashite kg., B.C. 1378, but dub., cf. Hpt:BAS i (1889), 183, Jeremias:Izdubar-Nimrod, 1891, 1 ff.);—son of [[כּוּשׁ]] (q.v.), hero and hunter Ge 10:8, Ge 10:9 (J; kg. in Babylonia, builder of Nineveh, etc. v:Ge 10:10 f.), [[נִמְרוֹד]] 1 Ch l:l0; [[אֶרֶץ נִמְרׂד]] Mic 5:5 (‖[[אֶרֶץ אַשּׁוּר]]); LXX Nebrwd.
